verses.kjv: And all the congregation lifted up their voice, and cried; and the people wept that night.
verses.web: All the congregation lifted up their voice, and cried; and the people wept that night.
verses.ct: That night, the entire community broke down crying, wailing out loud and weeping until morning.

verses.kjv: And all the children of Israel murmured against Moses and against Aaron: and the whole congregation said unto them, Would God that we had died in the land of Egypt! or would God we had died in this wilderness!
verses.web: All the children of Israel murmured against Moses and against Aaron. The whole congregation said to them, “We wish that we had died in the land of Egypt, or that we had died in this wilderness!
verses.ct: All the Israelites complained bitterly against Moses and Aaron. The whole community said to them, "We wish we had died back in Egypt! We wish we had died right here in this wilderness!"

verses.kjv: And wherefore hath the LORD brought us unto this land, to fall by the sword, that our wives and our children should be a prey? were it not better for us to return into Egypt?
verses.web: Why does LORD bring us to this land, to fall by the sword? Our wives and our little ones will be captured or killed! Wouldn’t it be better for us to return into Egypt?”
verses.ct: "Why is the LORD bringing us into this land just to be killed in battle? Our wives and children will be captured and enslaved! Wouldn't it be better to go back to Egypt?"

verses.kjv: And they said one to another, Let us make a captain, and let us return into Egypt.
verses.web: They said to one another, “Let’s choose a leader, and let’s return into Egypt.”
verses.ct: They said to each other, "Let's pick a new leader and head back to Egypt."

verses.kjv: Then Moses and Aaron fell on their faces before all the assembly of the congregation of the children of Israel.
verses.web: Then Moses and Aaron fell on their faces before all the assembly of the congregation of the children of Israel.
verses.ct: Moses and Aaron fell facedown on the ground in front of the entire Israelite assembly.

verses.kjv: And Joshua the son of Nun, and Caleb the son of Jephunneh, which were of them that searched the land, rent their clothes:
verses.web: Joshua the son of Nun and Caleb the son of Jephunneh, who were of those who spied out the land, tore their clothes.
verses.ct: Joshua son of Nun and Caleb son of Jephunneh, two of the men who had explored the land, tore their clothes in grief.

verses.kjv: And they spake unto all the company of the children of Israel, saying, The land, which we passed through to search it, is an exceeding good land.
verses.web: They spoke to all the congregation of the children of Israel, saying, “The land, which we passed through to spy it out, is an exceedingly good land.
verses.ct: They spoke to the whole Israelite community and said, "The land we explored is an incredibly good land!"

verses.kjv: If the LORD delight in us, then he will bring us into this land, and give it us; a land which floweth with milk and honey.
verses.web: If LORD delights in us, then he will bring us into this land, and give it to us: a land which flows with milk and honey.
verses.ct: "If the LORD is pleased with us, he will bring us into that land and give it to us — a land flowing with milk and honey."

verses.kjv: Only rebel not ye against the LORD, neither fear ye the people of the land; for they are bread for us: their defence is departed from them, and the LORD is with us: fear them not.
verses.web: Only don’t rebel against LORD, neither fear the people of the land; for they are bread for us. Their defense is removed from over them, and LORD is with us. Don’t fear them.”
verses.ct: "Just don't rebel against the LORD, and don't fear the people living there. We will devour them like bread! Their protection is gone, and the LORD is with us. Don't be afraid of them."

verses.kjv: But all the congregation bade stone them with stones. And the glory of the LORD appeared in the tabernacle of the congregation before all the children of Israel.
verses.web: But all the congregation threatened to stone them with stones. LORD’s glory appeared in the Tent of Meeting to all the children of Israel.
verses.ct: But the whole community was ready to stone them. Then the glory of the LORD appeared at the Tent of Meeting for all the Israelites to see.

verses.kjv: And the LORD said unto Moses, How long will this people provoke me? and how long will it be ere they believe me, for all the signs which I have shewed among them?
verses.web: LORD said to Moses, “How long will this people despise me? and how long will they not believe in me, for all the signs which I have worked among them?
verses.ct: The LORD said to Moses, "How long will these people treat me with contempt? How long will they refuse to trust me, despite all the signs I've performed among them?"

verses.kjv: I will smite them with the pestilence, and disinherit them, and will make of thee a greater nation and mightier than they.
verses.web: I will strike them with the pestilence, and disinherit them, and will make of you a nation greater and mightier than they.”
verses.ct: "I will strike them with a plague and wipe them out. Then I will make you into a nation greater and mightier than they are."

verses.kjv: And Moses said unto the LORD, Then the Egyptians shall hear it, (for thou broughtest up this people in thy might from among them;)
verses.web: Moses said to LORD, “Then the Egyptians will hear it; for you brought up this people in your might from among them.
verses.ct: But Moses said to the LORD, "The Egyptians will hear about it! After all, you used your power to bring this people out from among them."

verses.kjv: And they will tell it to the inhabitants of this land: for they have heard that thou LORD art among this people, that thou LORD art seen face to face, and that thy cloud standeth over them, and that thou goest before them, by day time in a pillar of a cloud, and in a pillar of fire by night.
verses.web: They will tell it to the inhabitants of this land. They have heard that you LORD are among this people; for you LORD are seen face to face, and your cloud stands over them, and you go before them, in a pillar of cloud by day, and in a pillar of fire by night.
verses.ct: "And they will tell the people living in this land. They've already heard that you, LORD, are among this people — that you, LORD, are seen face to face, that your cloud stands over them, and that you go ahead of them in a pillar of cloud by day and a pillar of fire by night."

verses.kjv: Now if thou shalt kill all this people as one man, then the nations which have heard the fame of thee will speak, saying,
verses.web: Now if you killed this people as one man, then the nations which have heard the fame of you will speak, saying,
verses.ct: "If you kill all these people at once, the nations that have heard about you will say,"

verses.kjv: Because the LORD was not able to bring this people into the land which he sware unto them, therefore he hath slain them in the wilderness.
verses.web: ‘Because LORD was not able to bring this people into the land which he swore to them, therefore he has slain them in the wilderness.’
verses.ct: "'The LORD wasn't able to bring these people into the land he promised them, so he slaughtered them in the wilderness.'"

verses.kjv: And now, I beseech thee, let the power of my LORD be great, according as thou hast spoken, saying,
verses.web: Now please let the power of the Lord be great, according as you have spoken, saying,
verses.ct: "So now, I beg you, let the power of the Lord be displayed in its greatness, just as you declared when you said,"

verses.kjv: The LORD is longsuffering, and of great mercy, forgiving iniquity and transgression, and by no means clearing the guilty, visiting the iniquity of the fathers upon the children unto the third and fourth generation.
verses.web: ‘LORD is slow to anger, and abundant in loving kindness, forgiving iniquity and disobedience; and he will by no means clear the guilty, visiting the iniquity of the fathers on the children, on the third and on the fourth generation.’
verses.ct: "'The LORD is slow to anger and overflowing with mercy, forgiving sin and rebellion. Yet he does not leave the guilty unpunished, bringing the consequences of the parents' sin upon their children to the 3rd and 4th generation.'"

verses.kjv: Pardon, I beseech thee, the iniquity of this people according unto the greatness of thy mercy, and as thou hast forgiven this people, from Egypt even until now.
verses.web: Please pardon the iniquity of this people according to the greatness of your loving kindness, and just as you have forgiven this people, from Egypt even until now.”
verses.ct: "Please forgive the sin of this people because of your great mercy, just as you have forgiven them again and again from the time they left Egypt until now."

verses.kjv: And the LORD said, I have pardoned according to thy word:
verses.web: LORD said, “I have pardoned according to your word;
verses.ct: The LORD replied, "I have forgiven them, as you asked."

verses.kjv: But as truly as I live, all the earth shall be filled with the glory of the LORD.
verses.web: but in very deed—as I live, and as all the earth shall be filled with LORD’s glory—
verses.ct: "But as surely as I live, and as surely as the whole earth will be filled with the glory of the LORD —"

verses.kjv: Because all those men which have seen my glory, and my miracles, which I did in Egypt and in the wilderness, and have tempted me now these ten times, and have not hearkened to my voice;
verses.web: because all those men who have seen my glory, and my signs, which I worked in Egypt and in the wilderness, yet have tempted me these ten times, and have not listened to my voice;
verses.ct: "not one of the people who saw my glory and the miraculous signs I performed in Egypt and in the wilderness — who tested me 10 times and refused to listen to me —"

verses.kjv: Surely they shall not see the land which I sware unto their fathers, neither shall any of them that provoked me see it:
verses.web: surely they shall not see the land which I swore to their fathers, neither shall any of those who despised me see it.
verses.ct: "not one of them will ever see the land I promised to their ancestors. No one who treated me with contempt will ever set foot in it."

verses.kjv: But my servant Caleb, because he had another spirit with him, and hath followed me fully, him will I bring into the land whereinto he went; and his seed shall possess it.
verses.web: But my servant Caleb, because he had another spirit with him, and has followed me fully, him I will bring into the land into which he went. His offspring shall possess it.
verses.ct: "But my servant Caleb is different. He has a different spirit in him and has followed me wholeheartedly. I will bring him into the land he explored, and his descendants will possess it."

verses.kjv: (Now the Amalekites and the Canaanites dwelt in the valley.) Tomorrow turn you, and get you into the wilderness by the way of the Red sea.
verses.web: Since the Amalekite and the Canaanite dwell in the valley, tomorrow turn and go into the wilderness by the way to the Red Sea.”
verses.ct: "Since the Amalekites and Canaanites are living in the valley, turn around tomorrow and head back into the wilderness along the road toward the Red Sea."

verses.kjv: And the LORD spake unto Moses and unto Aaron, saying,
verses.web: LORD spoke to Moses and to Aaron, saying,
verses.ct: The LORD spoke to Moses and Aaron and said,

verses.kjv: How long shall I bear with this evil congregation, which murmur against me? I have heard the murmurings of the children of Israel, which they murmur against me.
verses.web: “How long shall I bear with this evil congregation that complain against me? I have heard the complaints of the children of Israel, which they complain against me.
verses.ct: "How long must I put up with this wicked community that keeps complaining against me? I have heard every word of the Israelites' grumbling."

verses.kjv: Say unto them, As truly as I live, saith the LORD, as ye have spoken in mine ears, so will I do to you:
verses.web: Tell them, ‘As I live, says LORD, surely as you have spoken in my ears, so I will do to you.
verses.ct: "Tell them: 'As surely as I live,' declares the LORD, 'I will do to you exactly what I heard you say.'"

verses.kjv: Your carcases shall fall in this wilderness; and all that were numbered of you, according to your whole number, from twenty years old and upward, which have murmured against me,
verses.web: Your dead bodies shall fall in this wilderness; and all who were counted of you, according to your whole number, from twenty years old and upward, who have complained against me,
verses.ct: "Your dead bodies will drop in this wilderness — every one of you who was counted in the census, everyone 20 years old and older who has complained against me."

verses.kjv: Doubtless ye shall not come into the land, concerning which I sware to make you dwell therein, save Caleb the son of Jephunneh, and Joshua the son of Nun.
verses.web: surely you shall not come into the land concerning which I swore that I would make you dwell therein, except Caleb the son of Jephunneh, and Joshua the son of Nun.
verses.ct: "Not one of you will enter the land I swore to give you as a home — except Caleb son of Jephunneh and Joshua son of Nun."

verses.kjv: But your little ones, which ye said should be a prey, them will I bring in, and they shall know the land which ye have despised.
verses.web: But I will bring your little ones that you said should be captured or killed in, and they shall know the land which you have rejected.
verses.ct: "But your little children — the ones you said would be captured and enslaved — I will bring them in, and they will enjoy the land you rejected."

verses.kjv: But as for you, your carcases, they shall fall in this wilderness.
verses.web: But as for you, your dead bodies shall fall in this wilderness.
verses.ct: "As for you, your dead bodies will fall in this wilderness."

verses.kjv: And your children shall wander in the wilderness forty years, and bear your whoredoms, until your carcases be wasted in the wilderness.
verses.web: Your children shall be wanderers in the wilderness forty years, and shall bear your prostitution, until your dead bodies are consumed in the wilderness.
verses.ct: "Your children will wander in this wilderness for 40 years, bearing the burden of your unfaithfulness, until the last of your bodies has decayed in the wilderness."

verses.kjv: After the number of the days in which ye searched the land, even forty days, each day for a year, shall ye bear your iniquities, even forty years, and ye shall know my breach of promise.
verses.web: After the number of the days in which you spied out the land, even forty days, for every day a year, you will bear your iniquities, even forty years, and you will know my alienation.’
verses.ct: "You explored the land for 40 days, so you will suffer for your sins 40 years — one year for each day. Then you will understand what it means to have me against you."

verses.kjv: I the LORD have said, I will surely do it unto all this evil congregation, that are gathered together against me: in this wilderness they shall be consumed, and there they shall die.
verses.web: I, LORD, have spoken. I will surely do this to all this evil congregation who are gathered together against me. In this wilderness they shall be consumed, and there they shall die.”
verses.ct: "I, the LORD, have spoken. I will certainly do this to every member of this wicked community that has banded together against me. They will waste away in this wilderness, and here they will die."

verses.kjv: And the men, which Moses sent to search the land, who returned, and made all the congregation to murmur against him, by bringing up a slander upon the land,
verses.web: The men whom Moses sent to spy out the land, who returned and made all the congregation to murmur against him by bringing up an evil report against the land,
verses.ct: The men Moses had sent to explore the land — the ones who came back and turned the whole community against him by spreading a terrifying report about the land —

verses.kjv: Even those men that did bring up the evil report upon the land, died by the plague before the LORD.
verses.web: even those men who brought up an evil report of the land, died by the plague before LORD.
verses.ct: those men who spread the bad report about the land were struck down by a plague and died in the presence of the LORD.

verses.kjv: But Joshua the son of Nun, and Caleb the son of Jephunneh, which were of the men that went to search the land, lived still.
verses.web: But Joshua the son of Nun and Caleb the son of Jephunneh remained alive of those men who went to spy out the land.
verses.ct: Of all the men who had gone to explore the land, only Joshua son of Nun and Caleb son of Jephunneh survived.

verses.kjv: And Moses told these sayings unto all the children of Israel: and the people mourned greatly.
verses.web: Moses told these words to all the children of Israel, and the people mourned greatly.
verses.ct: When Moses reported all of this to the Israelites, the people were overcome with grief.

verses.kjv: And they rose up early in the morning, and gat them up into the top of the mountain, saying, Lo, we be here, and will go up unto the place which the LORD hath promised: for we have sinned.
verses.web: They rose up early in the morning and went up to the top of the mountain, saying, “Behold, we are here, and will go up to the place which LORD has promised; for we have sinned.”
verses.ct: Early the next morning, they headed up toward the hilltop and said, "We're here now! We'll go up to the place the LORD promised. We know we've sinned."

verses.kjv: And Moses said, Wherefore now do ye transgress the commandment of the LORD? but it shall not prosper.
verses.web: Moses said, “Why now do you disobey the commandment of LORD, since it shall not prosper?
verses.ct: But Moses said, "Why are you disobeying the LORD's command? This will not succeed."

verses.kjv: Go not up, for the LORD is not among you; that ye be not smitten before your enemies.
verses.web: Don’t go up, for LORD isn’t among you; that way you won’t be struck down before your enemies.
verses.ct: "Don't go up there! The LORD is not with you, and you will be crushed by your enemies."

verses.kjv: For the Amalekites and the Canaanites are there before you, and ye shall fall by the sword: because ye are turned away from the LORD, therefore the LORD will not be with you.
verses.web: For there the Amalekite and the Canaanite are before you, and you will fall by the sword because you turned back from following LORD; therefore LORD will not be with you.”
verses.ct: "The Amalekites and Canaanites are waiting for you there, and you will be cut down by the sword. Because you have turned away from the LORD, the LORD will not be with you."

verses.kjv: But they presumed to go up unto the hill top: nevertheless the ark of the covenant of the LORD, and Moses, departed not out of the camp.
verses.web: But they presumed to go up to the top of the mountain. Nevertheless, the ark of LORD’s covenant and Moses didn’t depart out of the camp.
verses.ct: But they stubbornly charged up toward the hilltop anyway. Neither the ark of the LORD's covenant nor Moses left the camp.

verses.kjv: Then the Amalekites came down, and the Canaanites which dwelt in that hill, and smote them, and discomfited them, even unto Hormah.
verses.web: Then the Amalekites came down, and the Canaanites who lived in that mountain, and struck them and beat them down, even to Hormah.
verses.ct: The Amalekites and the Canaanites who lived in that hill country came down and attacked them, beating them back and chasing them all the way to Hormah.
